On 15 November 2023, leadership of the KMT and the TPP announced that they would field a single joint presidential ticket, with the parties' previously chosen nominees serving as presidential and vice-presidential candidates. The order was to be chosen based on opinion polls and publicly announced on 18 November,[3] but the two sides were unable to come to an agreement on that date, leaving the fate of the proposed joint ticket in doubt.[4]


Domestic issues, such as energy policy, national defense and economic development have featured as campaign issues in the election, coupled by foreign issues mostly concerning Taiwan’s Cross-Strait relations with Mainland China, and relations with the United States.[5][6]


As of 14 November 2023, four presidential candidates have been nominated by a party or qualified as an independent, making the election the most contested since 2000. The winner of the 2024 presidential election is scheduled to be inaugurated on 20 May 2024.
